org.fife.rsta.ui

Class GoToDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.fife.rsta.ui.EscapableDialog
                • org.fife.rsta.ui.GoToDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GoToDialog
extends EscapableDialog
    A "Go To" dialog allowing you to go to a specific line number in an instance of RSyntaxTextArea.

    Example usage: 

     GoToDialog dialog = new GoToDialog(window);
 dialog.setMaxLineNumberAllowed(textArea.getLineCount());
 dialog.setVisible(true);
 int line = dialog.getLineNumber();
 if (line > 0) {
        try {
                textArea.setCaretPosition(textArea.getLineStartOffset(line - 1));
        } catch (BadLocationException ble) {
                ble.printStackTrace(); // Never happens
        }
 }
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Robert Futrell
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()

      • attemptToGetGoToLine

        private boolean attemptToGetGoToLine()
        Called when they've clicked OK or pressed Enter; check the line number they entered for validity and if it's okay, close this dialog. If it isn't okay, display an error message.
        Returns:
        Whether the line number was valid. In this case, this dialog will be hidden when this method returns.

      • createButtonPanel

        protected java.awt.Container createButtonPanel(javax.swing.JButton ok,
                                               javax.swing.JButton cancel)
        Returns a panel containing the OK and Cancel buttons. This panel is added to the bottom of this dialog. Applications that don't like these buttons right-aligned in the dialog can override this method to change that behavior.
        Parameters:
        ok - The OK button.
        cancel - The Cancel button.
        Returns:
        A panel containing the two buttons.

      • displayInvalidLineNumberMessage

        protected void displayInvalidLineNumberMessage()
        Displays a message to the user that they have entered an invalid line number. The default implementation displays the error message in a modal. Subclasses that wish to have a slicker error delivery mechanism can override.

      • escapePressed

        protected void escapePressed()
        Called when the user clicks Cancel or hits the Escape key. This hides the dialog.
        Overrides:
        escapePressed in class EscapableDialog

        Returns:

      • getLineNumber

        public int getLineNumber()
        Gets the line number the user entered to go to.
        Returns:
        The line number the user decided to go to, or -1 if the dialog was canceled. If valid, this will be 1-based, not 0-based.

        public int getMaxLineNumberAllowed()
        Returns the maximum line number the user is allowed to enter.
